title: PDB v2.0 File Format documentation
content: Where I can find such information? I've already read the undocumented windows 2000 secrets explanation of it but it isn't complete. For example the 3rd stream format isn't explained. I have looked at this, where some general info about the streams is given but nothing more.

comments.text: Thanks for your answers! I looked at the links given. It really seems that this file format isn't very documented. I read this article and I'm wondering where this "allocation bit array" is stored in the file?

If anyone is still looking for information I've nailed down reading and writing PDB 7.0 (MSF 7.00). The code is much clearer than other projects so you might want to refer to it: github.com/jcdickinson/symblr/tree/master/Symblr.Core/Symbols/â€¦

answers_data.content:
You can find some information about PDB on the blog of PDBParse's author:

This article is a good resource about PDB :

Other link on the subject :

I hope you will find your happiness in these links ;)

Here is something directly from Microsoft.

https://github.com/Microsoft/microsoft-pdb

comments.text: Straight from the horse's mouth, as the saying goes: "Open source, from Microsoft with love". Well found! (How did you come across it?)
@usr2564301 probably he read some news about that when Google started working on switching to Clang

answers_data.content:
Since the format is internal to Microsoft you likely won't find any official documentation. The best bet is various reverse engineering efforts on the format:

P.S. I just remembered that there is an open-source Microsoft project called "CCI Metadata" which does provide some C# code for reading and writing PDB files. Not sure about the legality of using it to make your own PDB parser, but it does provide information which is probably as the close to official docs as you can get.
